fields.description: Unique identifier for the Marketing Cloud account.
Unique identifier for the parent Marketing Cloud account.
A unique identifier for a specific send job. This value is unique across all accounts.
The identifier of the list used for the send.
The identifier of the batch in which the subscriber resides.
A system-generated unique identifier for the subscriber.
The subscriber's external unique identifier.
The date the send was initiated.
The domain associated with the subscriber's email address.

The unique identifier for the triggered send definition.

The type of bounce that occurred.

The date the click took place.
The domain at which the click occurred.
The URL for the link clicked. No AMPscript or variables are populated in this column, for example, www.example.com?%%attribute%%.
The link name assigned in the email send.
The link content assigned in the email send. AMPscript and variables are populated in this column, such as www.example.com?12345.
Whether the event is unique or repeated.
